title: A touchestone for this time present expresly declaring such ruines, enormities, and abuses as trouble the Churche of God and our Christian common wealth at this daye. VVherevnto is annexed a perfect rule to be obserued of all parents and scholemaisters, in the trayning vp of their schollers and children in learning. Newly set foorth by E.H.
author: Hake, Edward, fl. 1560-1604.
publisher: By [W. Williamson for] Thomas Hacket, and are to be solde at his shop at the greene Dragon in the Royall Exchange,
notes: "A compendious fourme of education", a verse adaptation of "De pueris ad virtutem instituendis" by Desiderius Erasmus, has separate divisional title; register is continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
